name: 朴維鎮
objective: This course introduces useful tools and methods for data analysis and graphics. The main topics of this course include models that are widely used in various fields to describe data and indices, plots for exploring characteristics and patterns of data, and estimation and prediction based on the data models. In addition, we will discuss how to generate random sample from several probability distributions and how to solve optimization problems frequently encountered in several areas. The tool used in this course is R.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to ‘Data Analysis and Graphics’
Week 2 Introduction to R
Week 3 Operations in R
Week 4 Vector and matrix
Week 5 Tabulation and graphics
Week 6 Probability distributions – Part I
Week 7 Probability distributions – Part II
Week 8 Basic statistics Part I: Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, variance, correlation, covariance
Week 9 Basic statistics Part II: Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, variance, correlation, covariance 
Week 10 Basic statistics Part III: Hypothesis tests
Week 11 Basic statistics Part IV: Hypothesis tests
Week 12 Simple linear regression – Part I
Week 13 Simple linear regression – Part II
Week 14 Multiple linear regression – Part I
Week 15 Multiple linear regression – Part II
Week 16 Presentation I
Week 17 Presentation II
Week 18 Presentation III
materials:
Engineering Statistics (5th Ed., Wiley) by Montgomery, Runger, and Hubele (ISBN: 978-0-324-59433-1)
